p: HBV and HCV infection meet accepted criteria for disease elimination. However, appropriate resources, commitment and allocation are currently lacking. If the right parties work together, including governments, international organisations, the private sector and civil society, great success can be achieved. Modelling studies have indicated that if core interventions are implemented with sufficient service coverage, elimination could be accomplished. This will require collecting strategic information, planning of programmes with involvement of all stakeholders, engaging civil society, arranging financial support and implementing appropriate strategies for target populations [5]. Key for the viral hepatitis response is to be integrated within countries' efforts to achieve universal health coverage as part of the 2030 Sustainable Development Goals.
